title: De Witte Raaf font
content:
Hi  
Could someone help me with identifying fotns from Da Witte Raaft title ?  
 [http://lectoratenakvstjoost.files.wordpress.com/2008/09/dewitteraaf122.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131221141251/http:/lectoratenakvstjoost.files.wordpress.com/2008/09/dewitteraaf122.jpg "http://lectoratenakvstjoost.files.wordpress.com/2008/09/dewitteraaf122.jpg")  
And here new version: [http://www.ingeketelers.be/assets/big/work\_77\_656.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131221141251/http:/www.ingeketelers.be/assets/big/work_77_656.jpg "http://www.ingeketelers.be/assets/big/work\_77\_656.jpg") -\> looks "leiturish" but there are differences betwen Leitura Display and that.  
Thank you for help in advance, and for your time.
author: jarsson

comments.content:
It's [Photina](http://web.archive.org/web/20131221141251/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/photina/) by Jose Mendoza y Almeida.One of my favorites.

- Mike Yanega

Nice call Mike!

This is a case where 'WhatTheFont' got it right. With some quick work in Photoshop you end up with the image below, which when submitted to WTF comes back with the perfect match.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131221141251im_/http:/typophile.com/files/dewitteraaf122_6640.jpg)

Thanks Jeff. I found it with my [Serif Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20131221141251/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsearch.php). I made the assumption that the lettering below the name was the same font, and that gave me the M and J to help narrow it down. (At the moment, my server seems down, hmmm.)

- Mike Yanega
Thanks for providing the link to your 'Serif Guide'. It's been way too long since I've visited your site and that is an incredible resource that I didn't know existed.
